speaker: Catacombs
lines: The passage divides where a root broke the ceiling and decided to live here.
Left smells of iron and beeswax. Right smells of paper and time.
Your lantern smokes a little; the smoke curls into letters that refuse to spell.
A beetle pushes a pearl of dust uphill with the earnestness of a saint.
A strand of hair crosses the floor like a line you are meant to draw.
Somewhere deep, water counts to seven and starts again.
You count to eight out of spite and feel better.
There are rules here. They are courteous enough to wait for you to break them.

choices.text: Turn back; the beetle deserves to win.
